thread.title: Seminole to host Jones in 3A-3 shootout
thread.title_full: Seminole to host Jones in 3A-3 shootout

author: Fred Fehr Contributing Writer
title: Seminole to host Jones in 3A-3 shootout
text: Posted Oct. 15, 2015 at 11:20 AM By Fred FehrContributing Writer Posted Oct. 15, 2015 at 11:20 AM Sole possession of the District 3A-3 lead will be on the line Thursday night (7:30) when Seminole entertains Jones. Mike Snyder’s Seminole squad has captured five straight victories since opening the season with a 27-21 setback to Class 4A Harrah. Seminole, like Jones, is 2-0 in district play, including a 40-21 triumph over Kingfisher last Friday night. Senior Dake Reese propelled Seminole’s 290-yard rushing attack with touchdown runs of 10, 10, 67 and 69 yards. Reese also caught a 16-yard scoring pass from Logan Long. Seminole didn’t turn the ball over while Kingfisher committed four turnovers — two fumbles and two interceptions. Senior Kash Davis chalked up an 18-yard scoring reception for the Chieftains. Jones upped its record to 6-0 with a 52-6 humbling of Little Axe. Like Seminole, Jones didn’t have a turnover while forcing four Little Axe miscues — three fumbles and an interception. Quarterback Brandon George of Jones posted scoring tosses of 69, 23 and 16 yards. He also had a 4-yard scoring run. Jones has permitted only 51 points in six games while netting 221. Bristow at McLoud. Coming off a 29-14 triumph over Tecumseh, McLoud will try to upgrade its playoff hopes at 7 p.m. Thursday. The Redskins, 2-5 overall, are fifth in District 4A-2 at 1-2. Tuttle is atop the district at 3-0 following a 28-27 win at Harrah. Tuttle overcame a 27-7 deficit. Harrah is second in the district at 2-1, Ada is third at 2-0 and Bristow is fourth at 1-1. The top four teams in the final regular-season district standings advance to the playoffs. Dallas Harris of McLoud recorded touchdown runs of 28 and 74 yards against Tecumseh. Other 4A-2 Thursday matchups are Ada ((3-2, 2-0) at Tuttle (7-0, 3-0) and Tecumseh (1-5, 0-2) at Glenpool (2-4, 0-3). Quarterback Gus Hull scored on runs of 7 and 10 yards last week against McLoud. Hull had two first-half scoring runs nullified by penalties. By Fred Fehr
